node.statement: STEP 1: Compute Phi_2(p) and Phi_2(q). Let p(x) = (x-a)(x-b) with a < b, so p has roots lambda_1 = a, lambda_2 = b. By definition (node 1.1), H_p(a) = sum_{j != 1} 1/(a - lambda_j) = 1/(a - b). Similarly H_p(b) = sum_{j != 2} 1/(b - lambda_j) = 1/(b - a). Note (a-b) = -(b-a), so (a-b)^2 = (b-a)^2. Therefore Phi_2(p) = H_p(a)^2 + H_p(b)^2 = 1/(a-b)^2 + 1/(b-a)^2 = 1/(b-a)^2 + 1/(b-a)^2 = 2/(b-a)^2. By identical reasoning applied to q(x) = (x-c)(x-d) with c < d: H_q(c) = 1/(c-d), H_q(d) = 1/(d-c), so Phi_2(q) = 2/(d-c)^2.
